answers.a: Canthaxanthin (E161g) is an orange‑red carotenoid (xanthophyll) used as a food color, occurring naturally in some organisms and also produced synthetically or by microbial fermentation.

answers.q: how is canthaxanthin used in food
answers.a: It’s added as a color to give orange to red hues in products like beverages, sauces, confectionery, and dairy analogues where permitted; it’s also used in fish and poultry feed to enhance flesh and yolk color.
Commercially it’s made by chemical synthesis or by fermenting selected microorganisms that biosynthesize the pigment, then purified and formulated; it isn’t practical or safe to produce at home.

answers.q: what color fool coloring is canthaxanthin in?
